citation.article-title: Flavisolibacter ginsengiterrae gen. nov., sp. nov. and Flavisolibacter ginsengisoli sp. nov., isolated from ginseng cultivating soil.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Flavisolibacter (Fla.vi.so.li.bac′ter. L. adj. flavus yellow; L. n. solum soil; N.L. masc. n. bacter a rod; N.L. masc. n. Flavisolibacter a yellow, rod-shaped bacterium from soil).
Nitrate is not reduced under aerobic conditions.
The major fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0 and iso-C17 : 0 3-OH.
The major respiratory quinone is MK-7.
Homospermidine is the major polyamine component.
Positioned phylogenetically within the phylum Bacteroidetes.
The type species is Flavisolibacter ginsengiterrae.
